item.title: Getting started with rest
item.description: REST Overview # REST stands for REpresentational State Transfer and was coined by Roy Fielding in his doctoral thesis Architectural Styles and the Design of Network-based Software Architectures. In it he identifies specific architectural principles like: Addressable Resources: the key abstraction of information and data in REST is a resource and each resource must be addressable via a URI. A uniform, constrained interface: use of small set of well-defined methods to manipulate our resources.
